body_html:
Summaries may be another case related to #19671. I think they both create resources with unique names, so they'll both hit our kernel cache. You could probably reset the graph and set the random seed to work around them both.

I am planning to fix the kernel caching issues (hopefully relatively soon), and I have a fix out for review on the losses collection issue. Thank you for the reports!
body_text:
Summaries may be another case related to #19671. I think they both create resources with unique names, so they'll both hit our kernel cache. You could probably reset the graph and set the random seed to work around them both.
I am planning to fix the kernel caching issues (hopefully relatively soon), and I have a fix out for review on the losses collection issue. Thank you for the reports!
body:
Summaries may be another case related to https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/19671. I think they both create resources with unique names, so they'll both hit our kernel cache. You could probably reset the graph and set the random seed to work around them both.

I am planning to fix the kernel caching issues (hopefully relatively soon), and I have a fix out for review on the losses collection issue. Thank you for the reports!
